anime.description: A gag comedy about http://anidb.net/ch48576 [Oshiri Kajiri Mushi XVIII], a 10-year-old insect who goes to Biting School to inherit his family`s Biting Shop business. Source: ANN

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: mina
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, the word mina refers to a broad audience, which can be said to be "the entire family", from the grumpy grandpa to the newborn baby. In Japanese, the word means simply "everyone", and has no anime/manga-related connotations at all. It does not comprise a style or a genre per se, but rather indicates the publisher`s intended target demographic. Mina works are deliberately targeted at a range of people as wide as possible, and are commonly associated with high-budget releases that require a very large audience to be financially viable. They usually bring mildly philosophical themes so that the adults can be interested, but do so without bringing objectionable content so that the children can be allowed to watch, and indeed also feature content specifically geared to spark their interest.

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

episode.title: 発見, 黄金のおしり!?
The Discovery of the Golden Butt?!
Hakken, Ougon no Oshiri!?
episode.summary: Every Bottom Biting Bug hunts for the golden butt, but one might have had the pleasure of taking a chomp. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大ピンチ, かじり虫!?
B.B.B. In Trouble!?
Dai Pinch, Kajiri Mushi!?
episode.summary: The deadliest thing to a bottom biting bug is a fart, and B.B.B. gets a mouth full. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勝負, かじりテスト!?
Showdown! The Biting Test!?
Shoubu, Kajiri Test!?
episode.summary: Gabriel is determined to beat B.B.B. in today’s biting test. “Determination!” “Passion!” “Guts!” Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かじり屋, 本日開店!?
The Bitery Opens Today!?
Kajiriya, Honjitsu Kaiten!?
episode.summary: Bottom Biting Bug learns about “Bottom Biter Wisdom.” Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 作文, ぼくの家族!?
An Essay About My Family?!
Sakubun, Boku no Kazoku!?
episode.summary: B.B.B. parents make working at a Bitery more interesting than what it really is for his school report. In the end, they might have gone too far. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 冒険, かえる橋を突破せよ!?
Adventure: Cross the Frog Bridge!?
Bouken, Kaerubashi o Toppa Seyo!?
episode.summary: B.B.B. has to face his fears to save his Grandma! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 応援, たーすけ君の恋!?
Help Tasuke-kun`s Love!?
Ouen, Tasuke-kun no Koi!?
episode.summary: In the worse kept secret every, B.B.B. and friends attempt to help Tasuke win his crush. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ダーティかじり虫ブラック!?
Dirty Bottom Biter Black!?
Dirty Kajiri Mushi Black!?
episode.summary: The Dirty Bottom Biter is causing trouble everywhere. It`s up to the kids to stop him! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 町の発明王, ジジ!?
Gramps, the Town`s Inventor King!?
Machi no Hatsumei Ou, Jiji!?
episode.summary: Gramps can’t bite anymore, but his inventions pack a bigger punch. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 立て, 立つんだチチ!?
Get Up, Dad, Get Up!?
Tate, Tatsunda Chichi!?
episode.summary: B.B.B.`s father goes on a training trip to regain his bite. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドキドキ, 初めてのおるすばん!?
Eeek, First Time Home Alone!?
Dokidoki, Hajimete no Orusuban!?
episode.summary: With the adults away, the Bugs will play Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強, おかん対決!?
Super Tough, The Clash of the Mothers!?
Saikyou, Okan Taiketsu!?
episode.summary: B.B.B.`s mom vs. Gabuerero`s mom Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いじめっこ, ガブレロの涙!?
Tears of the Bully, Gabriel!?
Ijimekko, Gabrello no Namida!?
episode.summary: Gabriel has ramped up his bullying in light of recent terrible news. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お願い, 歯の神様!?
Please, God of Teeth!?
Onegai, Ha no Kamisama!?
episode.summary: The heart and soul of the bottom biting bug is his teeth. But when Kajirimushi loses one, he is at a lost. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大スター, KJR!?
The Big Star, KJR!?
Dai Star, KJR!?
episode.summary: KJR, the dancing bug in the background, finally get his chance to shine! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大戦争, ひみつ基地!?
A Great War, Secret Bases!?
Daisensou, Himitsu Kichi!?
episode.summary: Fat’s mom is being really annoying, but there is no time for that as the crew must protect Princess Capline from Gabriel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ワァー, テレビ局が来た!?
Ah, the TV Station Is Here!?
Waaa, Televi-kyoku ga Kita!?
episode.summary: The Bitery has been randomly selected to be live on the show “Charge! Shops that are the talk of the town!” and do an on air bite. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お見事, かじりスケート!?
Well Done, Biter Skate!?
Omigoto, Kajiri Skate!?
episode.summary: Due to a mistake B.B.B and Tasuke hit he ice with one instruction, win! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ホント!? ジジのプロポーズ
For Real!? Grandpa`s Proposal
Honto!? Jiji no Propose
episode.summary: Grandma confuses B.B.B about Grandpa’s epic marriage proposal. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 救え, たこやき"一平"!?
Save "Ippei" Octopus Balls?!
Sukue, Takoyaki "Ippei"!?
episode.summary: Tasuke’s family restaurant is not doing so well, the community teams together to come up with new recipe ideas. Source: crunchyroll
